title: Seriously Asian: All About Dumplings
summary: Seriously Asian: All About Dumplings is a dairy free recipe with 5 servings. This main course has 697 calories, 37g of protein, and 41g of fat per serving. For $1.73 per serving, this recipe covers 28% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe is liked by 18 foodies and cooks. A mixture of garam masala, shaoxing rice wine, cumin, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. To use up the cumin you could follow this main course with the Moroccan Chocolate Mousse as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 49 hours and 47 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 77%, this dish is solid. Similar recipes include Asian Dumplings, Asian Dumplings, and Asian Chicken Dumplings.

winePairing.pairingText: Gewurztraminer, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are great choices for Asian. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. One wine you could try is Alsace Willm Cuvee Emile Willm Gewurztraminer. It has 4.7 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 23 dollars.

productMatches.title: Alsace Willm Cuvee Emile Willm Gewurztraminer
productMatches.description: Straw-colored with an aromatic nose both fruit forward (litchi) and floral (rose or violet). In the mouth the attack is supple with notes of mango. A robust wine, fat and powerful. The finish is smooth and silky with notes of roses and spices and the headiness of wallflowers.
